overview: Numbers chronicles Israel's 40-year wilderness journey from Sinai to the plains of Moab. It's named for the two censuses of Israel and reveals both God's faithfulness and the consequences of unbelief.

verses.text: The LORD bless you and keep you; the LORD make his face to shine upon you and be gracious to you; the LORD lift up his countenance upon you and give you peace.
God is not man, that he should lie, or a son of man, that he should change his mind. Has he said, and will he not do it? Or has he spoken, and will he not fulfill it?
The LORD is slow to anger and abounding in steadfast love, forgiving iniquity and transgression.

passages.title: The Twelve Spies
passages.summary: Twelve spies explore Canaan; ten give a fearful report, but Joshua and Caleb trust God. Israel's unbelief results in 40 years of wandering.

passages.title: The Bronze Serpent
passages.summary: When poisonous snakes afflict Israel, God instructs Moses to make a bronze serpent. All who look at it live—Jesus references this as a picture of His crucifixion.

passages.title: Balaam's Blessing
passages.summary: A pagan prophet is hired to curse Israel but can only bless them, declaring a future star and scepter from Jacob—a messianic prophecy.

facts.text: The priestly blessing (Numbers 6:24-26) has been used in Jewish and Christian worship for over 3,000 years.
The 40 years of wandering meant an entire generation died in the wilderness—everyone over 20 except Joshua and Caleb.
Jesus compared His crucifixion to Moses lifting up the bronze serpent (John 3:14-15).
Balaam's donkey speaking is one of only two times in Scripture an animal speaks (the serpent in Eden being the other).

figures.name: Moses
figures.description: Israel's leader through the wilderness, who faithfully interceded for the rebellious people but was not allowed to enter the Promised Land due to his own disobedience.

figures.name: Joshua
figures.description: One of the two faithful spies who trusted God's promise. He would become Moses' successor and lead Israel into Canaan.

figures.name: Caleb
figures.description: The other faithful spy who, at 85 years old, still had the strength and faith to claim his inheritance in the Promised Land.

figures.name: Balaam
figures.description: A pagan prophet whose greed led him to attempt cursing Israel. Though God turned his curses to blessings, Balaam later led Israel into sin.
